field.name: summary
field.value: RedirectToSiteRoot() is broken when Context.ApplicationPath is non-empty

field.name: description
field.value: Let's say your site is located at /mysite and you request /mysite/controller/action.castle. Calling RedirectToSiteRoot() in the controller will redirect you to /mysite/controller/mysite/, which is not correct. The slash in BaseResponse.RedirectToSiteRoot() should be prepended (not appended) to make the path absolute. I'm using an old MonoRail v1 build, but this code looks to be unchanged in the latest version of MonoRail. It's surprising a bug like this has managed to elude detection for so long!

comment.author: jonorossi
comment.text: MonoRail2 is not actively maintained, closing this issue as won't fix because of its age. Feel free to relog a new issue on GitHub: https://github.com/castleproject/MonoRail/issues
